ristinollaai

Class Ristinolla

  • java.lang.Object
    • ristinollaai.Ristinolla

  • public class Ristinolla
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Ristinolla/Tic-Tac-Toe game class. It contains the board(2d char array), the state of the game and available moves. The board consists of empty spaces '.', 'x' marks, and 'o' marks. spacesLeft is always up to date by being incremented at the appropriate times. The current player represents the player who will place the next mark.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ristinolla

        public Ristinolla(int size,
                  boolean xGoesFirst)
        Constructor. Give the size of the game board and whether or not x goes first or 'o' goes first. x is recommended as is the default for tic-tac-toe.
        Parameters:
        size -
        xGoesFirst -

    • Method Detail

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Method for printing the board onto the console. It will print the board array separated by --- and | to look sort of like a tic-tac-toe board.

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard(int size)
        Method for initializing the board with all empty marks.
        Parameters:
        size -

      • calcAvailableMoves

        public DoubleLinkList calcAvailableMoves()
        This method returns a list of the available moves left. This is needed to always have the right order list due to minimax iterating. Getting rid of this and replacing the moves list with perhaps a self organizing heap might improve performance.
        Returns:

      • calcAvailableMovesSorted

        public DoubleLinkList calcAvailableMovesSorted()
        Method for getting the remaining available moves so that they are roughly sorted for move-ordering in the minmax ab pruning algorithm to improve performance. Is not currently used as it does not improve performance.
        Returns:

      • isBoardFull

        public boolean isBoardFull()
        Method for checking if the game is over by no more availabe spaces.
        Returns:

        public static boolean checkForWin(char[][] board)
